intro: Quercus coccifera subsp. kryptocarpa, commonly known as the Kryptocarpa rock栎, is a shrub or small tree native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its small, leathery leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, acorn-like fruits that are usually clustered in groups of two to four. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates. This subspecies is notable for its ecological importance in supporting local wildlife and its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
